stimulusHtml: Which of the following events explains the connection between Portugal and Africa evident in the painting?

features.html:
Source 1

  • The painting shows a wedding ceremony between a light-skinned groom and a light-skinned bride.

  • The groom and bride are both crowned and wearing elaborate, colorful clothing.

  • A bishop in religious regalia stands before the bride and groom to conduct the ceremony.

  • The groom and bride are flanked by richly dressed attendants.

  • In the upper right background, a group of dark-skinned musicians in colorful uniforms play various musical instruments.

 

Source 2

The detail is a close-up view of the musicians in the upper right corner of the St. Auta Altarpiece painting.

  • Five musicians wear red and green uniforms with gold hats. 

  • The musicians are playing various types of horns.

Bridgeman Images

choicesHtml: In the eleventh century, Portugal began trading with the Swahili Coast city-states, and the Portuguese language united East African city-states.
In the early 1500s, Portugal began to control of trade in the Indian Ocean.
In the late 1400s, West Africa began directly supplying Portugal with gold.
In the 1200s, Great Zimbabwe traded ivory with the African coast and Portugal.
